programme.title: Star Wars: Episode IV - A New Hope
programme.desc: Classic sci-fi film. A young farmhand and a Jedi master set out to rescue a princess.

programme.title: Shop on TV
programme.desc: Indulge in a world of incredible deals and must-have products.

programme.title: The Motorbike Show
programme.desc: Henry Cole sets out on a Moto Morini through the Mendip Hills while visiting cheese shops, and celebrations are made to mark 25 years of the Suzuki Hayabusa.

programme.title: Night Vision
programme.desc: Night Vision

programme.title: Deal or No Deal
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern is joined by Sonya as she aims to become a jackpot winner and give as good as she gets from the Banker.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: News, current affairs and lively debate.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Lorraine Kelly presents a topical mix of entertainment, discussion and showbiz gossip.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: With just 48 hours to go before the celebrities enter camp, Sian reports with an Im A Celebrity exclusive. Plus, Jordon Cox reveals his top festive deals - from a rollercoaster.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Join the Loose Women team as they interview celebrity guests and discuss topical issues.

programme.title: ITV Lunchtime News
programme.desc: News bulletins from ITV News.

programme.title: STV News
programme.desc: The STV National News covering all of Scotland.

programme.title: Dickinsons Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson is in Swindon with dealers Tracy Thackray Howitt, Alison Chapman, Simon Schneider and Fay Rutter.

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Fighting it out in this edition are Natassja and her auntie Ashley from Northern Ireland and married couples Jay and Shruti from Hertfordshire and Ian and Mary from Devon.

programme.title: Deal or No Deal
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts as Ush steps up to face the infamous Banker in the hope of leaving him 100,000 pounds worse off.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: All that stands between Steve originally from Bolton, Pat from Wiltshire, Michael from Pontefract, Louisa from Reading and thousands of pounds is the small matter of a Chaser.

programme.title: STV News at Six
programme.desc: STV News from Glasgow and the West.

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: National and international news with reports and analysis from ITVs Correspondents.

programme.title: Whats on Scotland
programme.desc: Laura Boyd and Emma Cameron look at whats creating a buzz around Scotland this week.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Kev is sent spiralling, Paddy is troubled, and could Eve have seen her grandpa?

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Will returns home with something to get off his chest, Kevin refuses to help Tyrone, Gary offers Theo a lifeline, and Brodys mistimed outburst jeopardises Joanies homecoming.

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?
programme.desc: A million pounds is up for grabs and six new contestants are hoping to take it home - just 15 questions stand in their way as they see if they have what it takes.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: The days national and international news with a fresh perspective.

programme.title: STV News
programme.desc: The STV National News covering all of Scotland.

programme.title: Champions: Full Gallop
programme.desc: Documentary series. 70,000 fans pack Aintree for the Grand National - with one million pounds at stake, a new hero may yet emerge in racings most iconic race.

programme.title: Romesh Ranganathans Parents Evening
programme.desc: Romesh Ranganathan hosts the celebrity game show as Robbie Savage, Helen Flanagan and Tayce team up with their families to compete for charity.

programme.title: Deal or No Deal

programme.title: James Martins Great British Adventure
programme.desc: No adventure around the UK is complete without a trip to London, so James is checking out old haunts and stopping by Clare Smyths restaurant Core.

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh visits Grantham to surprise Rob and Margaret Isdale, who are in their 70s and have fostered over 150 vulnerable children in the UK over the last 45 years.

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Joining Alan for Remembrance Day 2025 are Petula Clark, Lady Glenconner, Alfie Boe, some hero hounds and a Windsor Grey who served for 14 years in the Royal Mews.

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: News bulletins from ITV News.

programme.title: James Martins Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is joined in the kitchen by TV property experts Scarlette and Stuart Douglas while also enjoying recipes from chefs Tommy Banks and Kenny Atkinson.

programme.title: Ainsleys Good Mood Food
programme.desc: Ainsley is feeling fruity in this episode as his recipes include a wonderful Wandsworth Mess and a rose harissa chicken tagine with apricots and chickpeas.

programme.desc: News bulletins from ITV News.

programme.title: Champions: Full Gallop
programme.desc: Documentary series. 70,000 fans pack Aintree for the Grand National - with one million pounds at stake, a new hero may yet emerge in racings most iconic race.

programme.title: STV Racing: Live from Cheltenham
programme.desc: Ed Chamberlin presents coverage of racing from Cheltenham and Wetherby - the feature meeting is at Cheltenham where the Paddy Power Gold Cup may unearth plenty of future stars.

programme.title: Celebrity Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts a celebrity special of the classic game show with Axel Blake, Richard Madeley, and Sian Welby all trying to say what they see for their chosen charities.

programme.title: The 1% Club
programme.desc: Lee Mack presents the ultimate leveller of a quiz show where it doesnt matter if youre not usually good at quizzes because the questions are all about logic and common sense.
